author: Johan Swarts
comment: Note that the 230 route starts AND ends at Melkbosstrand. Their is no option to see the return times. Please updated the service to include the missing return stops. Many thanks

author: tera mathebula
comment: A very crucial app for any would be MyCiti client\user. Timetable and fares always up to date. Routes and maps also a great as well as checking your card balance on the go.  Its my go to app for anything MyCiti related.

author: Hano Jordaan
comment: The app is good for seeing the routes and location of bus stops but the timetables are far off from the real bus times on the routes.

author: Andrew Archer
comment: Time tables aren't being kept up to date. This app is now outdated, please don't rely on the times presented. New routes are also not included. You're better off downloading the myciti time tables from the myciti website.  Edit: Back up to date. Tx

reply.author: Apkola
reply.content:
Hi Andrew,

Sorry about the delay in updating the timetables (we have to wait until they're published in a specific format by MyCiTi). We've just published an app update with new timetables and routes. Please let us know if there any problems!

author: sarah tallents
comment: Since the last update there are some services missing. Where have the T01 & X01 timetables gone? I was looking for times from Wood Station and they are completely gone....

reply.author: Apkola
reply.content: Hi Sarah, thanks for pointing this out - the Sunday timetable is missing for these routes. It appears MyCiTi have accidentally removed the Sunday timetable for a few of the routes on their website. We have made a plan and an app update will be published either tonight or tomorrow with updated timetables.

author: Patrick Mbuyu
comment: Very useful app! A must have for MyCiti users.

author: carmen snygans
comment: Not all bus stops are mentioned ,my stop which is Bontebok is situated between Spine & Imperial, not sure how they could have missed it.Also would be so perfect if we were able to load money or points on our cards via the app through internet banking.How does one enable the NFC facility I have a Huawei P8?

reply.author: Apkola
reply.content:
Hi Carmen,

Thanks for pointing out the problem with some stops not showing. We've just published an app update that does in fact contain Bontebok :)
Enabling NFC is done through your Android device settings.

title: Bus stops

author: Riaan Combrink
comment: Great app which is very useful. Only bug is the card scanner (main reason I downloaded it). Scanned card and got nonsense number like 83 000 points.  Appreciate the innovation,  but this aspect a letdown.

author: Dean Simonse
comment: I loved this app untill they stop updating the time tables. I will change my rating if that changes. The 234a busses don't line up with the time frames and no mention of the x02 or any other express busses.

reply.author: Apkola
reply.content:
Hi Dean,

Sorry about the delay in updating the timetables (we have to wait until they're published in a specific format by MyCiTi). We've just published an app update with new timetables and routes (including X02). Please let us know if there any problems!

author: Martin Stander
comment: All I'm wanting from this app is to put in the stop where I want to get on, and where I want to get off.  Find out the fare, time it will take and the time I need to get onto the bus in order to reach my destination on time. The app seems to do a lot but it's way overly complicated.

author: Stephan Kistner
comment: My first week in Cpt and this app helped ALOT for me as a first timer. The Nfc card scan feature is also pretty awesome!

author: Francois Duvenhage
comment: Good app but it only when I scan my card it only show my trips to work and not my trips back home. A bit of a letdown

reply.author: Apkola
reply.content:
Hi Francois,

Scanning your card will only show the last trip you've taken. So if you scan your card after arriving back home, it should show that trip too. Hope that helps!

author: basil burgess
comment: Its time for an app update, as routes and schedules have changed.     The only use I have for the app now is to check my card balance.

reply.author: Apkola
reply.content:
Hi Basil,

Sorry about the delay in updating the timetables (we have to wait until they're published in a specific format by MyCiTi). We've just published an app update with new timetables and routes. Please let us know if there any problems!

comment: This a good app but the time tables are outdated. Big problem if you need to go somewhere in you lunch hour.

Sorry about the delay in updating the timetables (we have to wait until they're published in a specific format by MyCiTi). We've just published an app update with new timetables and routes. Please let us know if there any problems!

author: Aubrey Thompson
comment: The information is so inaccurate, and it's so frustrating sitting here and the bus you waiting for does not arrive according to what the app says.
title: Unreliable

author: Matt de Neef
comment: Not sure about others' issues, but times and line info has been spot on for me. Scanning cards to get into is awesome and the map really helps. The Smartwatch companion is amazing as well on my ZenWatch 2. A very useful app!
title: Works perfectly

comment: Works well but the bus times are inaccurate! As such, I'll be uninstalling

reply.content:

Sorry about the delay in updating the timetables (we have to wait until they're published in a specific format by MyCiTi). We've just published an app update with new timetables and routes. Please let us know if there any problems!

comment: It can be much bettet if the card scanner can work also please thst is my problem for now

author: Tobias Preuss
comment: I specially like the offline functionality because I use my phone w/o SIM card. NFC card management is also nice.

author: Sivuyile Mxhosana
comment: Your bus delays and the lack of customer service ,why the bus has stop to every time at Camps bay bus stop..

author: Dale Koning
comment: Great so far. Would like to know when real time bus arrivals might be available, is it being developed?

author: Sheilah Brown
comment: Card scanner DOESN'T work, would have been very helpful, instead we have to go to a terminal to scan to check points.

reply.author: Apkola
reply.content:
Hi Sheilah,

Scanning a MyCiTi card can be a bit tricky. First you have to make sure your device supports NFC and that it's turned on (the app will let you know if there's a problem here). Then to scan your card you have to hold your card in just the right place on the back of your device. It can be tricky to find the right place. Hope this helps

comment: Can you plz update the app.With the new timetable and new Express of Atlantis and civic center Plz. Thx

reply.author: Apkola
reply.content:
Hi,

Sorry about the delay in updating the timetables (we have to wait until they're published in a specific format by MyCiTi). We've just published an app update with new timetables and routes (including the new X02 route). Please let us know if there any problems!

author: danielle plaatjies
comment: Not user friendly for a first time user

reply.author: Apkola
reply.content:
Hi Danielle,

We're sorry to hear that. If you have any suggestions on how we can improve it, we'd love to know. Thanks

comment: Love the app, works perfect. Very convenient.

title: MyCiti

comment: Please check the timetables under Thibault Square , some how you guys took out the To Waterfront route
title: Thibault Square has incomplete timetables

author: Jans Rautenbach
comment: The app works perfectly. The cards don't currently update on their own, and requires rescanning to update. This is a hassle, but not the dev's fault.
title: Good job

author: Albert de Bruyn
comment: Very nice. The available points cards  scan NFC facility is reliable and handy. I also love that there are no ads whatsoever! Good job! (From a Software Tester)
title: Does exactly what it's supposed to

title: Timetable update
